name: places/ChIJ5fEka91YwokRpgnqfcTsB48
formattedAddress: 510 E 62nd St, New York, NY 10065, USA
adrFormatAddress: 510 E 62nd St, New York, NY 10065, USA

originalText.text:
I took my cat, Olive, here Monday evening when she stopped putting weight on her right hind leg and showed signs of being in pain.

They got us in quickly and the vet techs and vet showed such care for her. While the prognosis was not good and I did have to take her in to my regular vet for a biopsy, the vet was very communicative and made sure I was able to take her home with a prescription for pain medication and clear instructions with how to proceed. Additionally, the hospital was able to set me up with a payment plan for the bills.

Looking over the invoice, the cost of the tests and prescriptions were actually very reasonable; the most expensive charge was the $290 emergency exam fee. While this is a lot of money for an exam, I consider it well worth the cost for the speed with which we were seen and the care they showed my cat.

Olive is doing better today but we are waiting on biopsy results to know more.

originalText.text: My 16yo dog Noah was transferred to AMC from another emergency vet hospital over Labor Day weekend for an emergency splenectomy. I cannot thank AMC enough for saving my dogs life. In his 16 years I’ve unfortunately had experience with emergency vet experiences and the level of attention and care that they provide not just your pet but also as the owner, spending time to call on a regular schedule to explain your pets current condition, patiently answer any and all questions you have, even sending photos on request, made an incredibly scary and dangerous situation more manageable. I’m thrilled to say my Noah is home and recovering better than I expected. The whole team, from surgery to ICU to intake, discharge and billing were so lovely and kind. Thank you!

originalText.text: There are not enough words to describe the level of care we received from the reception/admissions desk to the triage that took care of Zoe immediately upon arrival in the ER.  A special thank you to Dr Josh Chang for keeping me informed while Zoe was hospitalized and addressing all my questions in her medications she came home with.  Thank you and Happy Holidays!

originalText.text: Highly recommend the emergency medical department here! We received immediate attention in the middle of the night when our dachshund was diagnosed with stage 5 IVDD. The nurses & doctors performed emergency surgery successfully and gave our boy a 90% chance of recovery! Can’t thank the kind staff enough! Best ER in NYC

originalText.text: I had arrived early, and despite being very busy I was seen quickly and before my scheduled appointment time. The staff were knowledgeable and compassionate. I was given realistic options for my pet's complex needs and they went over the different costs associated with those pathways. They gave me a good resource for finding my pet's medicine at a more affordable rate. They have responded quickly to my emails.
